Those who practice simplicity in dress have time to visit the afflicted, and are better prepared to pray with and for them. On every Christian man and woman rests the solemn duty of regulating and contracting personal expenses, that by so doing they may be able to help the needy, feed the hungry, and clothe the naked.--Ms. 1, 1877, pp. 1-5. ("Simplicity in Dress," Oct. 23, 1877; printed in RH March 20, 1958.) 

Released Oct. 24, 1958.
